paragraph.paragraph: This sample consists of a command line SQL parser. SQL statements are filtered through a monitor and sent to the RDBMS.

list.item: Choose the location where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the configuration file.
Choose the targe according to the installed DBMS.

paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: This sample lets you interact with your database through a console.
First you have to enter the database connection information:

list.item:
For ODBC:
Database user authentication: Data Source Name: handson Name: smith Password: mypass
Note: Name and Password are no required with ODBC. If you don't need Name and Password, you can simply hit Return when prompted .

For Oracle:
Database user authentication: Name: smith@HANDSON Password: mypass
Note: you have to specify the Oracle User Name and Net Service Name with the syntax <user>@<service> where <user> stands for the User Name and <service> stands for the Net Service Name.

paragraph.paragraph: Then you can enter standard SQL queries to interact with your database, for instance:
paragraph.code_block: SQL> select firstname, lastname from CONTACTS where lastname = 'Smith' John Smith SQL>
paragraph.note: Note: enter exit to quit the application.
paragraph.heading: 2Under the Hood

list.item: ../../reference/db_control_chart.xml DB_CONTROL to connect and disconnect to your database.
